meanings.definition: Move or cause to move back and forth.
meanings.sent1: The toy train shuttled between the two ends of the track.
meanings.sent2: The worker shuttled the boxes from one room to another.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel shuttled the acorns in a playful dance.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts shuttled between excitement and nervousness.
meanings.sent5: The pendulum shuttled swiftly, counting the seconds.

meanings.definition: Transport people or goods back and forth.
meanings.sent1: The ferry shuttled passengers across the river all day.
meanings.sent2: The bus shuttled commuters between the city and the suburbs.
meanings.sent3: The ants shuttled food to their anthill with great teamwork.
meanings.sent4: The conveyor belt shuttled packages with efficiency.
meanings.sent5: The helicopter shuttled supplies to the remote village.

meanings.sent1: Grandma shuttled between her house and the market every day.
meanings.sent2: The courier shuttled between the post office and various neighborhoods.
meanings.sent3: The cat shuttled between sunbathing spots in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The bee shuttled between flowers, collecting nectar.
meanings.sent5: The student shuttled between classes on different floors.
